name: Classic Homemade White Bread
steps: Activate the Yeast: Dissolve sugar in warm water, sprinkle yeast over the top, and let sit for about 10 minutes until frothy.
Make the Dough: Add salt, butter, and flour to yeast mixture, mix to form shaggy dough. Knead on floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
First Rise: Place dough in lightly oiled bowl, cover with damp cloth, let rise in warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Shape the Bread: Punch down dough, shape into a loaf, place in greased loaf pan.
Second Rise: Cover loaf, let rise for 30 minutes or until puffs up above the rim of pan.
Optional Egg Wash: Beat egg with tablespoon of water, brush over loaf.
Bake: Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.
Cool: Remove bread from oven, cool in pan for a few minutes, then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.
Slice and Serve: Slice bread, serve warm or store in airtight container for up to 3 days.
notes: Use instant yeast to skip activation step; bread flour for chewier loaf; olive oil for dairy-free loaf; egg wash for golden crust; store at room temperature or freeze for up to 3 months; serving suggestions include butter, honey, or cinnamon sugar.
